ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Mistmoor Drum Goes Poof
ygData.msgSnippet: Yup, contact the GM for your server.  Worst case send an email to: servername@eqguide.org (no spaces on the server name ie: therathe@verant.com) That emails
ygData.messageBody:
Yup, contact the GM for your server. Worst case send an email to:

servername@... (no spaces on the server name ie:
therathe@...)

That emails the senior guide(s) and the GM Admin for the server as well as
the GM Lead Admin. Should get you some help. :)

Good luck.

Kev
----- Original Message -----
From: "Sylly Songsynger" <jgs@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, May 10, 2000 5:09 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Mistmoor Drum Goes Poof


> OMG - Noooooooooo!
>
> Tip #1 - be polite but persistent in contacting the head GM of your
server.
> It make take some time and some persistence and lots of politeness - and
> role play helps too. Persist.
>
> Tip#2 - move to kedge. Try for a drum off carolyn kelpmaiden - as good or
> close to Selos.
>
> Tip#3 - go to Naggy with guilds that need bards. At 42, you should be
> pretty respectable in your ability to regen mana and provide excellent
> resists - stack Elemental & Guardian with a drum <snif snif> equipped and
> have them look at their stats. Promise not to melee and to do your best
to
> keep their clerics from getting feared and ae'd.
>
> Tip#4 - camp MM and try for another drum.
>
> I dropped mine one time and died on the spot (looking for it as a couple
> clops beat on me) so that I would have the loc and be able to have my
party
> find it.
>
> Sylly
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: <Olmoss@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, May 10, 2000 3:47 PM
> Subject: [eqbards] Mistmoor Drum Goes Poof
>
>
> > The last month has been a blast singing Chant of Flame and Fufils
> > with my Mistmoor Drum... I was dropping Blues fast, mixing in a
> > fear chain every so often... Then, yesterday I was switching from my
> > lute, had the pointer over it and the Drum went "Poof" !!!
> > I backed up and searched the ground in a panic. Nothing there !!! I
> > petitioned and when the guide finally showed up her attitude
> > initially was "Tough Toenails".. I finally talked her into reporting
> > it to Verant as a possible Bug and if they review my log I MAY or may
> > not get a replacement. Moonflower is Disconsolate.. I love that drum.
> > Now the question is... at level 42, what are the chances of getting
> > a Drum of Selos March as a replacement ? ..rare drop off Nagafen ?
> > Any tips ?
> > I appreciate any advice you guys can give me,
> > Moonflower Bllue, 42 Bard
> > Cazic-Thule
> >
> >
> >
